name: "Back to the Future: The Game" Chapter 2 Multiple Choice Quiz  | 10 Questions
tags: Back to the Future: The Game

questions.text: While in 1932, Marty had to go back to the previous day. Why?
options: To ensure his grandparents met each other
To stop himself from altering the future
To break Doc Brown out of jail
questions.explanation:
To save Artie.

	After saving Doc in the previous episode, Arthur McFly was killed instead. That death, meant that Marty's dad, George, would never be born. Marty had to go back and save his grandfather in order to make sure he would be born.

questions.text: How did Marty sneak into Kid's hideout?
options: He put on a costume and walked in
He walked in with the band
He came in through the freight elevator
questions.explanation:
He hid in a crate.

	There were three crates in the alley near the hideout. When the player makes Marty open the medium crate a statue falls out. He hides the broken pieces and then climbs into the crate. The player earns the "Art Lover" achievement for climbing in.

questions.text: Which of Kid Tannen's henchmen was an artist?
questions.explanation:
Zane.

	While sneaking around in the hideout Marty sees Zane drawing a photo of a woman named Trixie. Cueball plays the piano. Matches showed no artistic talents. The other name was made up.

questions.text: What was Kid's speakeasy disguised as?
questions.explanation:
Ice Cream Parlor.

	Set during prohibition, drinking was illegal. Kid's speakeasy was hidden the basement of a building, but when the panic button was pressed it quickly turned into an ice cream parlor. This was also where Kid had Arthur McFly hidden away.

questions.text: Which of these is not the name of one of the Tannen's in the 1986 sequence?
questions.explanation:
Kid.

	After rescuing Arty, Doc and Marty return to 1986. It's not long before Marty realizes things are different when he can't get into his own house. Eventually Biff Tannen and his brothers Biff and Cliff show up.

questions.text: In 1986 Biff Tannen pulled a golden gun on Marty. Why didn't he get shot?
questions.explanation:
The gun was fake.

	When Biff pulled the trigger it was only a lighter, not an actual gun. The gun was a gift from the mob boss of Sacramento. Marty eventually escaped with Doc back into the past to attempt to right whatever wrong they had made to change history.

questions.text: After returning to 1932, how do you earn the "Door Prize" achievement?
questions.correct: Gain access to the speakeasy through the door.
options: Play a game and win a prize at the carnival.
Break down the door after being locked into a jail cell.
You win it just by traveling back in time.
questions.explanation:
Gain access to the speakeasy through the door.

	Players were asked random questions, and given a long list of random answers. Figuring out the correct response to three questions in a row gave access and the achievement.

questions.text: Officer Parker was on the take from Kid Tannen.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Marty discovered this while trying to convince Parker to arrest Tannen. Eventually Marty manages to convince Parker to turn on Tannen anyway. Good thing for Marty, as Ofc. Parker is his girlfriend, Jennifer's, grandfather.

questions.text: What invention was Doc. Brown working on?
questions.explanation:
Flying car.

	He had been watching Einstein, who was left behind in 1932 in the beginning of the story, and was using him as the test subject in the flying car. Doc planned to debut the car at the Hill Valley Expo that was coming up in a few months.

questions.text: What is significant about the photos on the wall in the speakeasy?
questions.correct: They are all people Kid had killed.
options: They are all people banned from drinking.
They are all people Kid had killed.
questions.explanation:
They are all people Kid had killed.

	Zane drew caricatures of every person Kid ever killed. In order to get Trixie to turn on Kid, Marty had Zane draw a picture of Arthur, which he then pinned to the wall. Once she thought Arthur was dead, she decided to help bust Kid.
